intro: Graphorkis bicallosa, commonly known as the two-spined hakea, is a shrub native to southern Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and dense foliage. The plant produces small, white or pinkish flowers arranged in cylindrical inflorescences. Its leaves are typically narrow and covered with fine, soft hairs. Graphorkis bicallosa is adapted to dry, sandy soils and is often found in coastal and heathland environments.
